meanings.definition: To remove a weapon from its holster.
meanings.sent2: The police officer unholsters his weapon to defend himself.
meanings.sent3: In the movie, the cowboy unholsters his gun dramatically during the showdown.
meanings.sent4: Her smile unholsters a wave of happiness in everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The magician unholsters a deck of cards with a flourish, ready to perform his next trick.

meanings.definition: To draw a weapon from its holster.
meanings.sent1: She unholsters her pistol swiftly in the face of danger.
meanings.sent2: During the duel, the gunslinger unholsters his revolver with lightning speed.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy spy accidentally unholsters his gun while trying to sneak past the guards.
meanings.sent4: His words unholster a flood of memories from her past.
meanings.sent5: The artist unholsters a brush and begins to paint a masterpiece on the canvas.
